title.rendered: Minecraft has sold 200 million copies and Mojang is getting a new name

content.rendered:
Minecraft has now sold 200 million times, as Microsoft has now announced. 126 million players are active monthly.

And the Minecraft world keeps growing. Most recently, Nvidia released five new worlds for the Minecraft RTX beta, and Minecraft Dungeons will be released next week. In addition, the Nether update for Minecraft can be expected in the summer.

Meanwhile, Mojang gets a new name. Or rather a name extension, because in future the team will be called Mojang Studios. This is accompanied by a new visual identity and of course an adapted logo. “These reforms demonstrate the solidarity of the development studios in Redmond and Stockholm and all team members who work worldwide on the popular block franchise,” it says.

In addition, due to the Covid-19 pandemic, the Education Edition of Minecraft for teachers is still available free of charge until the end of June. You will also find a range of free educational content there and in the main game, also free of charge on the Marketplace until the end of June.

Read more about Minecraft here.

There is something to celebrate.
